commit.title: Update specs, get rid of deprecation warnings
update travis.yml to support latest rubies
update Rakefile to support latest RSpec
update spec_helper to support latest RSpec
unlock versions of rspec and rake in development
Handle invalid semantic version from rubygems
Remove condition where blocked threads will wait indefinitely
ok fine, Travis, you win. Removing 2.2.1
Add Ruby 2.1 and 2.2 to travis config
Add the ability to provide a bundle-config file that passes its parameters to spitball
use puma as sinatra app server
add suport for multi-groups and tests
disable ree/1.8.7 since travis ci rvm uses rubygems 2.2.0
ensure it works with all gem versions
Add Travis CI status to the README
rely on a more sensible tmp dir
for bundler, just to the latest
add Gemfile lock to ignore file
delete cache dir if there is a problem
Merge branch 'cachefix' of https://github.com/lenn0x/spitball into lenn0x-cachefix
Use SPITBALL_CACHE in remote based on Josh's suggestion.
rewind the body before we return it
use host port for hash, write out cache file when its done
set STDOUT to sync true so version numbers can actually be output
extract some common functionality shared between regular and remote clients
only save file if it ends with tar.gz or tgz, otherwise, unpack it
add Josh to authors, clamp down loose deps
spit job output to stdout as well as tee to client
simpler impl that skips using bundler at all (god forgive me)
consider soruces, abort on non-zero exits from install
Merge branch 'use-bundler-directly' of github.com:freels/spitball into use-bundler-directly
add shebang rewriting and silence stdout in tests
use simpler test Gemfile/lock file so that specs can pass without mocking, atm.
Merge branch 'use-bundler-directly' of github.com:freels/spitball into use-bundler-directly
avoid rewriting bin wrappers if no bins exist
no need to poll the tarball url since we block the client until we are done
write sterr to stdout in order to pipe build failures to the client
rescue exceptions and print them to standard out so that they get piped down to the client
rewrite the shebang line of the bin wrappers rubygems creates to use whatever is in the env
pipe down bundler output over http for remote generation
increase remote wait time to 4 minutes
do not create local file until we get the data from the server
finite wait time if the remote fails. This needs some actual thought
fix server executable to actually start up
use cross-platform, atomic ln for the file lock
add SPITBALL_CACHE env config to help
specify port as separate cmd line argument
Add an exception for client-side errors and handle URI issues.
